title: Azarel
html: AZAREL(Azʹar·el) [God Has Helped].1. One of the mighty men who joined David at Ziklag.—1Ch 12:1, 6.2. Head of the 11th of the 24 divisions of temple singers in David’s time; also called Uzziel.—1Ch 25:1, 4, 18.3. Son of Jeroham and prince of the tribe of Dan under David’s rule.—1Ch 27:22; 28:1.4. One of the descendants of Binnui who, at Ezra’s urging, sent away their foreign wives and sons.—Ezr 10:19, 38-41, 44.5. Father or ancestor of the Amashsai who dwelt in Jerusalem under Governor Nehemiah. He was of the priestly house of Immer.—Ne 11:1, 13.6. A musician in the procession headed by Ezra as they walked atop Jerusalem’s rebuilt wall at its inauguration. Perhaps the same as No. 5 above.—Ne 12:31, 36.
